name: LEGISLATIVE FUNCTIONS
desc: Legislative functions: Includes most of the legislative branch. However, the Legislative functions: Library of Congress --except the Congressional Research Legislative functions: Service--, the Tax Court, the Government Printing Office --except for congressional printing and binding--, and the Copyright Royalty Tribunal are classified in other subfunctions.

name: DEDUCTIONS FOR OFFSETTING RECEIPTS
desc: Deductions for offsetting receipts: Includes general government function offsetting receipts that are not closely related to any other subfunction in this function. Deductions for offsetting receipts: Deductions for offsetting receipts

name: RESEARCH AND GENERAL EDUCATION AIDS
desc: Research and general education aids: Education research and assistance for the arts, the humanities, educational radio and television, public libraries, and museums.

name: OTHER ADVANCEMENT OF COMMERCE
desc: Other advancement of commerce: Loan programs to aid specialized forms of business --such as small business-- that are not included elsewhere in the functional structure. For such transactions undertaken prior to credit reform, includes the total cash flows. For activities under credit reform, includes the credit subsidy cost of the loans or guarantees. Also includes collecting and disseminating economic and demographic statistics --such as census data-- and regulating business. Other advancement of commerce: Other advancement of commerce

name: OTHER INTEREST
desc: Outlays for interest on the public debt. --Where this interest is paid to the public, it is on an accrual basis; all other interest outlays in the budget are on a cash basis.--: Other interest: Interest received by on-budget trust funds All other interest expenditures and offsetting receipts. The principal expenditure in this subfunction normally is interest on refunds of receipts. Since offsetting interest receipts are included in this subfunction, the subfunction totals are usually negative.: Interfund interest collected by on-budget nonrevolving trust funds. Most of this income derives from outlays included in subfunction , but this subfunction also includes offsetting receipts from investments in public debt securities issued by the Federal Financing Bank --FFB--. The principal expenditure in this subfunction normally is interest on refunds of receipts. Since offsetting interest receipts are included in this subfunction, the subfunction totals are usually negative.: Interfund interest collected by off-budget nonrevolving trust funds. Normally, all of this income comes from outlays included in subfunction . The principal expenditure in this subfunction normally is interest on refunds of receipts. Since offsetting interest receipts are included in this subfunction, the subfunction totals are usually negative.: All other interest expenditures and offsetting receipts. The principal expenditure in this subfunction normally is interest on refunds of receipts. Since offsetting interest receipts are included in this subfunction, the subfunction totals are usually negative.

name: OTHER GENERAL GOVERNMENT
desc: Other general government: Miscellaneous other costs, such as federal costs of territorial governments.

name: FEDERAL LITIGATIVE AND JUDICIAL ACTIVITIES
desc: Federal litigative and judicial activities: The cost of the judiciary, the cost of prosecution, and federal expenses connected with financing legal defense activities.

name: FOREIGN INFORMATION AND EXCHANGE ACTIVITIES
desc: Foreign information and exchange activities: Student and cultural exchange programs and foreign library, radio, or other media information activities designed to promote mutual understanding between the people of the United States and other nations. Foreign information and exchange activities: Foreign information and exchange activities Foreign information and exchange activities: Foreign information and exchange activities: Diplomatic and consular operations of the Department of State, assessed contributions to international organizations, and closely related activities in other agencies --such as the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency--. Foreign information and exchange activities: Conduct of foreign affairs Foreign information and exchange activities: Foreign information and exchange activities: The transfer of defense articles and services to foreign governments, including grants, credit sales, and training. Excludes the military sales trust fund, which is classified under subfunction --international financial programs--. Foreign information and exchange activities: International security assistance

name: HEALTH CARE SERVICES
desc: Health care services: Medical services to individuals and families, whether such services are provided directly by the federal government or financed through grants, contracts, insurance, or reimbursements.

name: FEDERAL EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT AND DISABILITY
desc: Federal employee retirement and disability: All funded retirement and disability programs restricted to federal employees. Includes military retirement benefits for all years, not just the years since the military retirement program began as a funded trust fund ----. In cases where retirement benefits are not funded --such as in the case of Coast Guard retired pay--, includes the cash benefits Federal employee retirement and disability: where the employees were employed --in the Coast Guard case, transportation--, because otherwise those functions would never be charged for the retirement costs of their employees.

name: CONSERVATION AND LAND MANAGEMENT
desc: Conservation and land management: Maintaining the public domain and national forests, encouraging conservation of private land, and reclaiming surface mining areas.

name: FARM INCOME STABILIZATION
desc: Farm income stabilization: Subsidies and other payments to stabilize agricultural prices at an equitable level. Includes acquiring and storing agricultural commodity stockpiles, but does not include foreign agricultural export losses --classified in the international affairs function-- or domestic donations of food --part of an income support, rather than a farm price support, program--. Includes the total cash flows of farm price support loans --that is, loans that can be repaid in cash or by surrendering title to the crop used as security for the loan--, which are not subject to credit reform. For all other agricultural loans and loan guarantees, includes either the total cash flows --for pre- loans and loan guarantees-- or the subsidy cost --for loans and loan guarantees subject to credit reform--.

name: ENERGY SUPPLY
desc: Energy supply: Increasing the supply of energy through the development of domestic resources and systems capable of using them. Includes the costs of research and demonstration of supply systems.

name: AREA AND REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT
desc: Area and regional development: Grants, loans, subsidies, and related aids for the economic development of depressed areas. For pre-credit reform loans, includes the total cash flows of the loans; for loans under credit reform, includes the credit subsidy cost of the loans. All these aids are generally for rural areas or are more regional than the community development programs. Area and regional development programs are generally carried out by agencies other than the Department of Housing and Urban Development, such as the Farmers Home Administration, Economic Development Administration, and Bureau of Indian Affairs. Grants, loans, subsidies, and related aids for the economic development of depressed areas. For pre-credit reform loans, includes the total cash flows of the loans; for loans under credit reform, includes the credit subsidy cost of the loans. All these aids are generally for rural areas or are more regional than the community development programs. Area and regional development programs are generally carried out by agencies other than the Department of Housing and Urban Development, such as the Farmers Home Administration, Economic Development Administration, and Bureau of Indian Affairs.: Grants, loans, subsidies, and related aids for the economic development of depressed areas. For pre-credit reform loans, includes the total cash flows of the loans; for loans under credit reform, includes the credit subsidy cost of the loans. All these aids are generally for rural areas or are more regional than the community development programs. Area and regional development programs are generally carried out by agencies other than the Department of Housing and Urban Development, such as the Farmers Home Administration, Economic Development Administration, and Bureau of Indian Affairs.

name: MORTGAGE CREDIT
desc: Mortgage credit: Includes the cash transactions for homeownership and Mortgage credit: related loan and insurance programs for pre-credit reform Mortgage credit: activity; under credit reform, includes the credit subsidy cost of any homeownership loans or guarantees.

name: FOOD AND NUTRITION ASSISTANCE
desc: Food and nutrition assistance: Providing food or nutritional assistance to individuals and families.

name: RECREATIONAL RESOURCES
desc: Recreational resources: Acquisition, improvement, and operation of recreational lands and facilities, including fish, wildlife, and parks; also preserving historic areas.

name: AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AND SERVICES
desc: Agricultural research and services: All other agricultural programs, such as agricultural research and extension services. Agricultural research and services: Agricultural research and services

name: POLLUTION CONTROL AND ABATEMENT
desc: Pollution control and abatement: Controlling and reducing air, water, and land pollution, or enhancing the environment. Excludes water resources programs, water treatment plants, and similar programs that are not funded as part of an environmental enhancement activity.

name: CONSUMER AND OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH AND SAFETY
desc: Consumer and occupational health and safety: Meat and poultry inspection, food and drug inspection, consumer product safety, and occupational health and safety. Consumer and occupational health and safety: Consumer and occupational health and safety

name: DISASTER RELIEF AND INSURANCE
desc: Disaster relief and insurance: Helping communities and families recover from natural disasters. Disaster relief and insurance: Disaster relief and insurance

name: WATER RESOURCES
desc: Water resources: Water protection, conservation, irrigation, and related activities, including the total costs of multipurpose water projects where it is not feasible to separate the transportation --navigation-- or energy --power-- segments of these projects. Controlling and reducing air, water, and land pollution, or enhancing the environment. Excludes water resources programs, water treatment plants, and similar programs that are not funded as part of an environmental enhancement activity.: Water protection, conservation, irrigation, and related activities, including the total costs of multipurpose water projects where it is not feasible to separate the transportation --navigation-- or energy --power-- segments of these projects.

name: HOUSING ASSISTANCE
desc: Housing assistance: Federal income support and related expenses that are specifically for financing or providing housing for individuals and families. Excludes loans, loan guarantees, or insurance. --The distinction between the housing assistance included in subfunction and the mortgage credit assistance in subfunction is that the subfunction Federal income support and related expenses that are specifically for financing or providing housing for individuals and families. Excludes loans, loan guarantees, or insurance. --The distinction between the housing assistance included in subfunction and the mortgage credit assistance in subfunction is that the subfunction: payments focus on subsidies to increase beneficiaries effective income, whereas the credit subsidies in subfunction are primarily aimed at encouraging the housing industry.--

name: COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT
desc: Development of physical facilities or financial infrastructures designed to promote viable community economies. Includes transportation facilities developed as an integral part of a community development program --rather than a transportation program--. Usually excludes aids to businesses unless such aids promote the economic development of depressed areas and are not designed to promote particular lines of business for their own sake. Usually excludes human development and services programs.: Community development Community development: Grants and related programs designed to aid largely urban community development. Includes community development block grants and predecessor activities, such as the urban renewal and model cities programs. These Grants and related programs designed to aid largely urban community development. Includes community development block grants and predecessor activities, such as the urban renewal and model cities programs. These: programs are generally carried out by the Department of Grants, loans, subsidies, and related aids for the economic development of depressed areas. For pre-credit reform loans, includes the total cash flows of the loans; for loans under credit reform, includes the credit subsidy cost of the loans. All these aids are generally for rural areas or are more regional than the community development programs. Area and regional development programs are generally carried out by agencies other than the Department of Housing and Urban Development, such as the Farmers Home Administration, Economic Development Administration, and Bureau of Indian Affairs.: Housing and Urban Development.

name: INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE
desc: International development and humanitarian assistance: Humanitarian assistance, development assistance, security support assistance, grants to and investments in international financial and development institutions, and the budgetary costs associated with concessionary agricultural exports.

name: GENERAL PURPOSE FISCAL ASSISTANCE

Includes payments in lieu of taxes, broad-purpose shared revenues, and the federal payment to the District of Columbia. Excludes payments specifically for community development or social services programs.

name: DEFENSE-RELATED ACTIVITIES
desc: Defense-related activities: Miscellaneous defense activities, such as the expenses connected with selective services and with defense stockpiles outside of the Departments of Defense and Energy. Defense-related activities: Defense-related activities

name: OTHER NATURAL RESOURCES
desc: Other natural resources: Miscellaneous natural resources programs, not classified under other subfunctions, such as marine-, earth-, and atmosphere-related research and geological surveys and mapping. Other natural resources: Other natural resources

name: DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE-MILITARY
desc: Department of Defense-Military: With minor exceptions, entire agency is included in this Department of Defense-Military: subfunction.

name: OTHER INCOME SECURITY
desc: Other income security: Income security programs not included in any other subfunction. Primarily either direct payments or grants-in- aid to finance direct payments that constitute cash income to low-income individuals and families. Also includes refugee assistance and both administrative expenses and offsetting collections in the income security function that are not part of any other subfunction. Other income security: Other income security

name: HEALTH RESEARCH AND TRAINING
desc: Health research and training: All research programs-whether basic or applied-that are financed specifically as health or medical research. Excludes research that is an integral part of other functions --such as biomedical research in the space program--.

name: MEDICARE
desc: Medicare: Federal hospital insurance and federal supplementary medical insurance, along with general fund subsidies of these funds and associated offsetting receipts. Medicare: Medicare Entire Medicare function.: Federal hospital insurance and federal supplementary medical insurance, along with general fund subsidies of these funds and associated offsetting receipts.

name: ATOMIC ENERGY DEFENSE ACTIVITIES
desc: Atomic energy defense activities: Department of Energy programs devoted to national defense, such as naval ship reactors and nuclear weapons.

name: SOCIAL SERVICES

Excludes education or training undertaken as an integral part of the achievement of other functions --such as training military personnel; veterans education, training, and rehabilitation; or training of health workers in a health program--. Nutrition or food service programs funded separately from social services or education are not part of this function-they are classified as income security. name: FEDERAL LAW ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES
desc: Federal law enforcement activities: The costs of operating the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Customs and Border Protection, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, the Drug Enforcement Administration, and Federal law enforcement activities: police and crime prevention activities in other programs. Also includes the readily identifiable enforcement cost of civil rights activities.

name: ELEMENTARY, SECONDARY, AND VOCATIONAL EDUCATION
desc: Preschool, elementary, secondary, and vocational education programs.

name: FEDERAL CORRECTIONAL ACTIVITIES
desc: Federal correctional activities: Covers the costs of incarceration, supervision, parole, and rehabilitation of federal prisoners.

name: CRIMINAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE
desc: Criminal justice assistance: Grants to state and local governments to assist them in operating and improving their law enforcement and justice systems. Criminal justice assistance: Criminal justice assistance

name: CONDUCT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS
desc: Conduct of foreign affairs: Diplomatic and consular operations of the Department of State, assessed contributions to international organizations, and closely related activities in other agencies --such as the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency--.

name: UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION

name: TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT
desc: Training and employment: Job or skill training, employment services and placement, and payments to employers to subsidize employment.

name: GENERAL RETIREMENT AND DISABILITY INSURANCE --EXCLUDING SOCIAL SECURITY--
desc: General retirement and disability insurance --excluding Social Security--: Non-needs-tested retirement and disability programs composed mainly of the Railroad Retirement Fund and special benefits for coal miners. Excludes programs specifically restricted to federal employees.

name: OTHER LABOR SERVICES
desc: Other labor services: Aids to or regulation of the labor market, including gathering labor statistics and mediation and conciliation services; excludes employment and training programs and occupational safety and health programs.

name: VETERANS EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND REHABILITATION
desc: Veterans education, training, and rehabilitation: Composed primarily of the G.I. Bill readjustment, vocational rehabilitation benefits, and related programs.

name: CENTRAL FISCAL OPERATIONS
desc: Central fiscal operations: Covers the general tax collection and fiscal operations of the Department of the Treasury.

name: INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL PROGRAMS
desc: The transfer of defense articles and services to foreign governments, including grants, credit sales, and training. name: GROUND TRANSPORTATION
desc: Ground transportation: Aid, and/or regulation of both for the various components of ground transportation, such as roads and highways, railroads, and urban mass transit. name: HIGHER EDUCATION
desc: Higher education: College and graduate school programs.

name: ENERGY CONSERVATION
desc: Energy conservation: Encouraging the prudent use of energy resources.

name: DEPOSIT INSURANCE
desc: Promotion and regulation of commerce and the housing credit and deposit insurance industries, which pertain to: collection and dissemination of social and economic data --unless they are an integral part of another function, such as health--; Deposit insurance: general purpose subsidies to businesses, including credit subsidies to the housing industry --for programs subject to credit reform, includes only the credit subsidy costs of loans and loan guarantees--; and Insurance programs protecting deposits in certain financial institutions; programs to resolve failed institutions. Deposit insurance activities are not subject to credit reform, so the budget records the cash flows for deposit insurance rather than their subsidy values.: the Postal Service fund and general fund subsidies of that fund. Promotion and regulation of commerce and the housing credit and deposit insurance industries, which pertain to: In general, includes credit and insurance programs; however, if such programs are a means of achieving the basic objectives of another function and are an integral part of the programs of that function, they are classified under the other function. Deposit insurance: Excludes regional economic development programs, even if they use credit or insurance to achieve a community development objective. Also excludes other insurance or loan programs --such as railroad loans-- that are an integral part of other functions. Insurance programs protecting deposits in certain financial institutions; programs to resolve failed institutions. Deposit insurance activities are not subject to credit reform, so the budget records the cash flows for deposit insurance rather than their subsidy values.: Promotion and regulation of commerce and the housing credit and deposit insurance industries, which pertain to: Mortgage credit Deposit insurance: Includes the cash transactions for homeownership and Insurance programs protecting deposits in certain financial institutions; programs to resolve failed institutions. Deposit insurance: Insurance programs protecting deposits in certain financial institutions; programs to resolve failed institutions. Deposit insurance activities are not subject to credit reform, so the budget records the cash flows for deposit insurance rather than their subsidy values.: Postal Service Promotion and regulation of commerce and the housing credit and deposit insurance industries, which pertain to: Any net outlays of the Postal Service included in the budget Deposit insurance: --or off-budget--. Insurance programs protecting deposits in certain financial institutions; programs to resolve failed institutions. Deposit insurance activities are not subject to credit reform, so the budget records the cash flows for deposit insurance rather than their subsidy values. Deposit insurance activities are not subject to credit reform, so the budget records the cash flows for deposit insurance rather than their subsidy values.: Page

name: INTEREST ON TREASURY DEBT SECURITIES --GROSS--
desc: Interest on Treasury debt securities --gross--: Outlays for interest on the public debt. --Where this interest is paid to the public, it is on an accrual basis; all other interest outlays in the budget are on a cash basis.--

name: INCOME SECURITY FOR VETERANS
desc: Income security for veterans: Veterans compensation, life insurance, pensions, and burial benefits.

name: SOCIAL SECURITY
desc: Social Security: Federal Old-Age and Survivors and Disability Insurance Trust Funds, along with general fund subsidies of these funds and associated offsetting collections. Social Security: Social Security Includes the entire Social Security function.: Federal Old-Age and Survivors and Disability Insurance Trust Funds, along with general fund subsidies of these funds and associated offsetting collections.

name: ENERGY INFORMATION, POLICY, AND REGULATION
desc: Energy information, policy, and regulation: Unallocable overhead activities of the Department of Energy plus the costs of energy information and regulation activities. Energy information, policy, and regulation: Energy information, policy, and regulation

name: EMERGENCY ENERGY PREPAREDNESS
desc: Emergency energy preparedness: Developing and maintaining a stockpile of energy resources --currently confined to petroleum-- to meet emergency needs and associated contingency planning activities.

name: GENERAL SCIENCE AND BASIC RESEARCH
desc: General science and basic research: Conducting the National Science Foundation programs and the general science activities of the Department of Energy.

name: AIR TRANSPORTATION
desc: Air transportation: Aid for and/or regulation of air transportation, including aeronautical research conducted by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. Aid for and/or regulation of air transportation, including aeronautical research conducted by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.: Aid for and/or regulation of air transportation, including aeronautical research conducted by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

name: OTHER TRANSPORTATION
desc: the construction of roads or other transportation facilities as an integral part of a broad community facility or regional development program where the clear intent of the program is regional development and the provision of transportation facilities is only an incidental by- product or means to attain the objective of regional development; and: research and technology activities devoted to space research --except aeronautical technology--, even though this research may eventually benefit general transportation. Other transportation: Ground transportation the construction of roads or other transportation facilities as an integral part of a broad community facility or regional development program where the clear intent of the program is regional development and the provision of transportation facilities is only an incidental by- product or means to attain the objective of regional development; and: Aid, and/or regulation of both for the various components of ground transportation, such as roads and highways, railroads, and urban mass transit. Other transportation: Air transportation the construction of roads or other transportation facilities as an integral part of a broad community facility or regional development program where the clear intent of the program is regional development and the provision of transportation facilities is only an incidental by- product or means to attain the objective of regional development; and: Aid for and/or regulation of air transportation, including aeronautical research conducted by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. Other transportation: Water transportation the construction of roads or other transportation facilities as an integral part of a broad community facility or regional development program where the clear intent of the program is regional development and the provision of transportation facilities is only an incidental by- product or means to attain the objective of regional development; and: Aid for and/or regulation of maritime commerce. Other transportation: Other transportation

name: WATER TRANSPORTATION
desc: Water transportation: Aid for and/or regulation of maritime commerce.

name: GENERAL PROPERTY AND RECORDS MANAGEMENT
desc: General property and records management: Most of the operations of the General Services Administration --net of reimbursements from other agencies for services rendered--.

name: EXECUTIVE DIRECTION AND MANAGEMENT
desc: Executive direction and management: The Executive Office of the President --unless some major grants or operating programs should be included in the Office--; occasionally some closely related spending outside the Office is included.

name: SPACE FLIGHT, RESEARCH, AND SUPPORTING ACTIVITIES
desc: Space flight, research, and supporting activities: Development and operation of space transportation systems, basic scientific research connected with outer space, research and demonstrations designed to promote

name: CENTRAL PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT
desc: Central personnel management: Most of the operating costs of the Office of Personnel Management and related agencies --net of reimbursements from other agencies for services rendered--.

name: POSTAL SERVICE
desc: the Postal Service fund and general fund subsidies of that fund.: In general, includes credit and insurance programs; however, if such programs are a means of achieving the basic objectives of another function and are an integral part of the programs of that function, they are classified under the other function. Postal Service: Excludes regional economic development programs, even if they use credit or insurance to achieve a community development objective. Also excludes other insurance or loan programs --such as railroad loans-- that are an integral part of other functions. Any net outlays of the Postal Service included in the budget: the Postal Service fund and general fund subsidies of that fund.: Mortgage credit Postal Service: Includes the cash transactions for homeownership and Any net outlays of the Postal Service included in the budget: related loan and insurance programs for pre-credit reform the Postal Service fund and general fund subsidies of that fund.: activity; under credit reform, includes the credit subsidy cost of any homeownership loans or guarantees. Postal Service: Any net outlays of the Postal Service included in the budget: Postal Service the Postal Service fund and general fund subsidies of that fund.: Any net outlays of the Postal Service included in the budget Postal Service: --or off-budget--.

name: VETERANS HOUSING
desc: Veterans housing: Housing loan and guarantee programs for veterans and dependents. Pre- housing loans and guarantees are recorded on a cash basis, whereas under credit reform --post---, the budget records the credit subsidy cost of the activity.

name: HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CARE FOR VETERANS
desc: Hospital and medical care for veterans: Medical care and research financed by the Department of Hospital and medical care for veterans: Veterans Affairs.

name: OTHER VETERANS BENEFITS AND SERVICES
desc: Other veterans benefits and services: Administrative expenses of the Department of Veterans

name: INTERNATIONAL SECURITY ASSISTANCE
desc: International security assistance: The transfer of defense articles and services to foreign governments, including grants, credit sales, and training. Excludes the military sales trust fund, which is classified under subfunction --international financial programs--.

name: OTHER INVESTMENT INCOME
desc: Other investment income: The actual and estimated earnings on private securities of the Railroad Retirement Investment Trust. The actual year returns include interest, dividends, and capital gains and losses on private equities and other securities. The trusts end-of-year balance reflects the current market value of resources available to the government to finance benefits. Other investment income: Other investment income

name: RENTS AND ROYALTIES ON THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF
INTEREST RECEIVED BY ON-BUDGET TRUST FUNDS
desc: Interest received by on-budget trust funds: Interfund interest collected by on-budget nonrevolving trust funds. Most of this income derives from outlays included in subfunction , but this subfunction also includes offsetting receipts from investments in public debt securities issued by the Federal Financing Bank --FFB--.

name: INTEREST RECEIVED BY OFF-BUDGET TRUST FUNDS
desc: Interest received by off-budget trust funds: Interfund interest collected by off-budget nonrevolving trust funds. Normally, all of this income comes from outlays included in subfunction .

name: DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
desc: The Department of Agriculture provides leadership on food, agriculture, natural resources, and related issues.

name: DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
desc: The Department of Health and Human Services protects the health of all Americans and provides essential human services.

name: DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR
desc: The Department of the Interior manages public lands and minerals, national parks, and wildlife refuges and upholds Federal trust responsibilities to Indian tribes and Native Alaskans. Additionally, Interior is responsible for endangered species conservation and other environmental conservation efforts.

name: DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE
desc: The Department of Justice works to enforce federal law, to seek just punishment for the guilty, and to ensure the fair and impartial administration of justice.

name: DEPARTMENT OF LABOR
desc: The Department of Labor administers a variety of federal labor laws to guarantee workers' rights to fair, safe, and healthy working conditions, including minimum hourly wage and overtime pay, protection against employment discrimination, and unemployment insurance.

name: DEPARTMENT OF STATE
desc: The Department of State advises the President and leads the nation in foreign policy issues. The State Department negotiates treaties and agreements with foreign entities, and represents the United States at the United Nations.

name: DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY
desc: The Treasury Department manages Federal finances by collecting taxes and paying bills and by managing currency, government accounts and public debt. The Treasury Department also enforces finance and tax laws.

name: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
desc: The mission of the Department of Education is to foster educational excellence and to ensure equal access to educational opportunity for all.

name: DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY
desc: The Department of Energy manages the United States' nuclear infrastructure and administers the country's energy policy. The Department of Energy also funds scientific research in the field.

name: DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION
desc: The Department of Transportation is responsible for planning and coordinating federal transportation projects. It also sets safety regulations for all major modes of transportation.

name: DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY
desc: Formed in from the combination of departments and agencies, the Department of Homeland Security works to improve the security of the United States. The Department's work includes customs, border, and immigration enforcement; emergency response to natural and manmade disasters; antiterrorism work; and cybersecurity.

name: DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT
desc: The Department of Housing and Urban Development administers programs that provide housing and community development assistance. The Department also works to ensure fair and equal housing opportunity for all.

name: OFFICE OF PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT
desc: OPM manages the civil service of the federal government, coordinates recruiting of new government employees, and manages their health insurance and retirement benefits programs. OPM also provides resources for locating student jobs, summer jobs, scholarships, and internships.

name: SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION
desc: The SBA helps Americans start, build and grow businesses. Through an extensive network of field offices and partnerships the SBA aids, counsels, assists and protects the interests of small business concerns.

name: DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
desc: For information about VA medical care or benefits, write, call or visit your nearest VA facility.

name: ADMINISTRATIVE CONFERENCE OF THE UNITED STATES
desc: The Administrative Conference of the United States is an independent federal agency dedicated to improving federal agency administrative processes and procedures.

name: ADVISORY COUNCIL ON HISTORIC PRESERVATION
desc: The Advisory Council on Historic Preservation encourages the preservation of historic properties across the nation.

name: APPALACHIAN REGIONAL COMMISSION
desc: The Appalachian Regional Commission works for sustainable community and economic development in Appalachia.

name: BARRY GOLDWATER SCHOLARSHIP AND EXCELLENCE IN EDUCATION FOUNDATION
CENTRAL INTELLIGENCE AGENCY
desc: The Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) is an independent US Government agency responsible for providing national security intelligence to senior US policymakers.

name: COMMISSION ON CIVIL RIGHTS
desc: The U.S. Commission on Civil Rights is an independent, bipartisan agency charged with monitoring federal civil rights enforcement.

name: COMMITTEE FOR PURCHASE FROM PEOPLE WHO ARE BLIND OR SEVERELY DISABLED
desc: The Committee gives jobs to people who are blind or have other significant disabilities in the manufacture and delivery of products and services to the Federal Government.

name: CONSUMER PRODUCT SAFETY COMMISSION
desc: The Consumer Product Safety Commission works to protect the public from the risks of injury or death from from products that pose a fire, electrical, chemical, or mechanical hazard, or can injure children.

name: UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS FOR VETERANS CLAIMS
DEFENSE NUCLEAR FACILITIES SAFETY BOARD
desc: The Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board reviews the content and implementation of health and safety standards at Department of Energy Defense Nuclear Facilities. The board also makes recommendations to the President and Secretary of Energy regarding health and safety issues at Defense Nuclear Facilities.

name: EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY COMMISSION
desc: The EEOC enforces laws that make discrimination illegal in the workplace. The commission oversees all types of work situations including hiring, firing, promotions, harassment, training, wages, and benefits.

name: EXPORT-IMPORT BANK OF THE UNITED STATES
FARM CREDIT SYSTEM INSURANCE CORPORATION
desc: The Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation ensures timely payment of interest and principal on Systemwide and consolidated bonds and other obligations issued by Farm Credit System banks.

name: FEDERAL DEPOSIT INSURANCE CORPORATION
desc: FDIC responds to questions about federal deposit insurance coverage and handles complaints and inquiries about FDIC-insured state banks which are not members of the Federal Reserve System.

name: FEDERAL MARITIME COMMISSION
desc: FMC is the regulatory agency overseeing ocean carriers and certain other entities, operating in the waterborne foreign commerce of the U.S. FMC assists consumers engaged in disputes with transporting carriers, ocean transportation intermediaries and cruise operators.

name: FEDERAL MINE SAFETY AND HEALTH REVIEW COMMISSION
FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION
desc: The FTC works for the consumer to prevent fraudulent, deceptive, and unfair business practices in the marketplace and to provide information to help consumers spot, stop, and avoid them. To file a complaint or to get free information on consumer issues, visit the website or call the toll-free number above. The FTC records consumer complaints (Internet, telemarketing, identity theft, and other fraud-related complaints) into the Consumer Sentinel Network, a secure, online database and investigative tool available to hundreds of civil and criminal law enforcement agencies.

name: INSTITUTE OF AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE CULTURE AND ARTS DEVELOPMENT
UNITED STATES INTERAGENCY COUNCIL ON HOMELESSNESS
NATIONAL ARCHIVES AND RECORDS ADMINISTRATION
desc: The National Archives and Records Administration preserves U.S. government records, manages the Presidential Libraries system, and publishes laws, regulations, Presidential, and other public documents.

name: NATIONAL COUNCIL ON DISABILITY
desc: The NCD is an independent federal agency making recommendations to the President and Congress on policies affecting Americans with disabilities. NCD works to empower individuals with disabilities and to promote equal opportunity.

name: NATIONAL CREDIT UNION ADMINISTRATION
desc: NCUA is the federal agency that charters and supervises federal credit unions and insures savings in federal and most state-chartered credit unions across the country through the National Credit Union Share Insurance Fund.

name: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR THE HUMANITIES
desc: The National Endowment for the Humanities funds humanities programs in the United States such as museums, archives, libraries, colleges, universities, public television, and radio stations, and individual scholars.

name: OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH REVIEW COMMISSION
OFFICE OF NAVAJO AND HOPI INDIAN RELOCATION
INSTITUTE OF MUSEUM AND LIBRARY SERVICES
UNITED MINE WORKERS OF AMERICA BENEFIT FUNDS
CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE
MORRIS K. UDALL AND STEWART L. UDALL FOUNDATION
CHEMICAL SAFETY AND HAZARD INVESTIGATION BOARD
desc: The Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board investigates industrial chemical accidents.

name: COURT SERVICES AND OFFENDER SUPERVISION AGENCY FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
desc: The Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency provides supervision of adults on parole, probation, and supervised release in the District of Columbia.

name: PRESIDIO TRUST
desc: The Presidio Trust preserves the Presidio National Park as an enduring resource for the American people.

name: DENALI COMMISSION
desc: The Denali Commission is an independent federal agency designed to provide critical utilities, infrastructure, and economic support throughout Alaska.

name: BROADCASTING BOARD OF GOVERNORS
desc: The Broadcasting Board of Governors broadcasts news and information about the United States and the world to audiences abroad.

name: OFFICE OF THE FEDERAL COORDINATOR FOR ALASKA NATURAL GAS TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS
FEDERAL HOUSING FINANCE AGENCY
desc: The Federal Housing Finance Agency provides supervision, regulation, and housing mission oversight of Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and the Federal Home Loan Banks.

name: NATIONAL RAILROAD PASSENGER CORPORATION OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL
BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION
desc: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau makes markets for consumer financial products and services work for Americans &#; whether they are applying for a mortgage, choosing among credit cards, or using any number of other consumer financial products.

name: SENATE
desc: The U.S. Senate and the U.S. House of Representatives make up the two chambers of Congress. The Senate has members, from each state, who are elected to serve for a term of years.

name: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
desc: The U.S. House of Representatives and the U.S. Senate make up the two chambers of Congress. The House has members, the number representing each state is determined by population.

name: OFFICE OF COMPLIANCE
desc: The Office of Compliance advances workplace rights, safety, health, and accessibility in the Legislative Branch.

name: CAPITOL POLICE
desc: U.S. Capitol Police Officers work to protect life and property, investigate criminal acts, and enforce traffic regulations on U.S. Capitol Grounds. Officers are also responsible for protecting members, officers of Congress, and their families.

name: CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET OFFICE
desc: The Congressional Budget Office produces independent, nonpartisan, analysis of economic and budgetary issues to support the Congressional budget process.

name: ARCHITECT OF THE CAPITOL
desc: The Architect of the Capitol manages and maintains the U.S. Capitol, the Capitol Visitor Center, the Senate Office Buildings, the House Office Buildings, the Supreme Court Building, the Library of Congress, the U.S. Botanic Garden, and the Capitol Grounds

name: SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES
UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE FEDERAL CIRCUIT
UNITED STATES COURT OF INTERNATIONAL TRADE
COURTS OF APPEALS, DISTRICT COURTS, AND OTHER JUDICIAL SERVICES
ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE OF THE UNITED STATES COURTS
ECONOMIC RESEARCH SERVICE
desc: The Economic Research Service provides the Department of Agriculture and the public economic information and research on food, agriculture, the environment and rural development.

name: AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH SERVICE
desc: The Agricultural Research Service works to find solutions to agricultural problems.

name: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF FOOD AND AGRICULTURE
desc: To find your local Cooperative Extension office, consult the county government listings in your local telephone directory.

name: ANIMAL AND PLANT HEALTH INSPECTION SERVICE
desc: The Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service protects and promotes U.S. agricultural health, regulates genetically engineered organisms, administers the Animal Welfare Act, and manages wildlife damage.

name: GRAIN INSPECTION, PACKERS AND STOCKYARDS ADMINISTRATION
AGRICULTURAL MARKETING SERVICE
desc: The Agricultural Marketing Service supports the fair marketing of U.S. agricultural products.

name: FOOD AND NUTRITION SERVICE
desc: FNS provides children and low-income people access to food, a healthful diet, and nutrition education.

name: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION
desc: The Economic Development Administration provides grants to economically distressed communities to generate new employment, and stimulate industrial and commercial growth.

name: BUREAU OF THE CENSUS
desc: The U.S. Census Bureau provides data about the nation's people and economy.

name: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STANDARDS AND TECHNOLOGY
FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION
desc: The FDA is responsible for protecting the public health by assuring the safety, efficacy, and security of human and veterinary drugs, biological products, medical devices, our nations food supply, cosmetics, and products that emit radiation. The FDA also provides accurate, science-based health information to the public.

name: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION
desc: CDC collaborates to create the expertise, information, and tools that people and communities need to protect their health through health promotion, prevention of disease, injury and disability, and preparedness for new health threats.

name: NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH
desc: The National Institutes of Health (NIH) is the primary Federal agency for conducting and supporting medical research.

name: SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES ADMINISTRATION
AGENCY FOR HEALTHCARE RESEARCH AND QUALITY
desc: The Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality supports research to improve the quality, safety, efficiency, and effectiveness of health care for all Americans.

name: CENTERS FOR MEDICARE AND MEDICAID SERVICES
ADMINISTRATION ON AGING
desc: AoA is the Federal focal point and advocate agency for older persons and their concerns. In this role, AoA works to heighten awareness among other Federal agencies, organizations, groups, and the public about the valuable contributions that older Americans make to the nation. AoA also alerts others to the needs of vulnerable older people. Through information, referral and outreach efforts at the community level, AoA seeks to educate older people and their caregivers about the benefits and services available to help them.

name: BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT
desc: The Bureau of Land Management manages outdoor recreation, livestock grazing, mineral development, and energy production on public lands.

name: OFFICE OF SURFACE MINING RECLAMATION AND ENFORCEMENT
BUREAU OF RECLAMATION
desc: The Bureau of Reclamation is a provider of wholesale water, and hydroelectric power in the U.S.

name: UNITED STATES FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE
BUREAU OF SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENTAL ENFORCEMENT
BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS AND BUREAU OF INDIAN EDUCATION
OFFICE OF THE SPECIAL TRUSTEE FOR AMERICAN INDIANS
DRUG ENFORCEMENT ADMINISTRATION
desc: The Drug Enforcement Administration enforces the United States' controlled substance laws and regulations and aims to reduce the supply of and demand for such substances.

name: BUREAU OF ALCOHOL, TOBACCO, FIREARMS, AND EXPLOSIVES
EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING ADMINISTRATION
desc: The Employment and Training Administration provides job training and assistance with finding jobs and careers.

name: EMPLOYEE BENEFITS SECURITY ADMINISTRATION
desc: The EBSA provides information and assistance on private sector, employer-sponsored retirement benefit and health benefit plans.

name: OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION
desc: OSHA to ensures safe and healthful working conditions for working men and women by setting and enforcing standards and by providing training, outreach, education and assistance.

name: BUREAU OF LABOR STATISTICS
desc: The Bureau of Labor Statistics measures labor market activity, working conditions, and price changes in the economy.

name: OFFICE OF FEDERAL CONTRACT COMPLIANCE PROGRAMS
ALCOHOL AND TOBACCO TAX AND TRADE BUREAU
desc: The Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau collects taxes and enforces regulations on alcohol, tobacco, firearms, and ammunition.

name: UNITED STATES MINT
desc: The Mint produces the the coins that circulate throughout the US. They also produce special edition coinage that can be purchased for coin collections.

name: INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE
desc: Free tax help is available from the Internal Revenue Service at www.IRS.gov hours a day, seven days a week. Numerous on-line applications, resources and taxpayer assistance services are available. Learn about electronic filing options, look up the status of your refund, print tax forms and instructions, look for preparers who can electronically file tax returns and find ways to connect with the IRS through New Media. If your personal tax questions require face-to-face assistance may visit the Taxpayer Assistance Centers closest to you. Locations are listed on IRS.gov.

name: OFFICE OF ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION
desc: A part of the Department of Education, the Office of Elementary and Secondary Education works to bolster the achievement of students in preschool through secondary school. The office also works to ensure equal education opportunities for all, and to provide assistance to state and local schools. (Contact information is for the Department of Education).

name: OFFICE OF SPECIAL EDUCATION AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
desc: OSERS provides a wide array of supports to parents and individuals, school districts and states in three main areas: special education, vocational rehabilitation and research.

name: OFFICE OF VOCATIONAL AND ADULT EDUCATION
desc: OVAE administers and coordinates programs that are related to adult education and literacy, career and technical education, and community colleges.

name: OFFICE OF POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION
desc: OPE develops programs to increase access to postsecondary education. This office works with state accreditation agencies to recognize institutions of higher learning that provide quality education.

name: FEDERAL AVIATION ADMINISTRATION
desc: The FAA works to ensure that all air travel is safe.

name: FEDERAL MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY ADMINISTRATION
desc: The FMCSA provides information about your rights when moving across state lines (interstate moves). Consumers should submit household goods commercial complaints or dangerous safety violations involving a commercial truck or bus to this agency.

name: NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION
desc: NHTSA wants to hear from consumers regarding potential defects in their cars. NHTSAs hotline has information on safety recalls; crash test ratings; child safety seats; bicycles; air bags; and impaired driving prevention.

name: PIPELINE AND HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SAFETY ADMINISTRATION
TRANSPORTATION SECURITY ADMINISTRATION
desc: The TSA can assist you with questions or concerns about travel tips, permitted and prohibited items, and information on filing a claim for items that were damaged or lost during a TSA screening.

name: FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY
desc: FEMA supports citizens and emergency personnel to build, sustain, and improve the nations capability to prepare for, protect against, respond to, recover from, and mitigate all hazards.

name: COMMUNITY PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT
desc: The Office of Community Planning and Development develops communities by promoting decent housing, suitable living environments, and expanded economic opportunities for low and moderate income people.

name: OFFICE OF LEAD HAZARD CONTROL AND HEALTHY HOMES
VETERANS HEALTH ADMINISTRATION
desc: VHA serves the needs of Americas veterans by providing primary care, specialized care, and related medical and social support services.

name: EXECUTIVE RESIDENCE AT THE WHITE HOUSE
SPECIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE PRESIDENT AND THE OFFICIAL RESIDENCE OF THE VICE PRESIDENT
COUNCIL ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND OFFICE OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY
NATIONAL SECURITY COUNCIL AND HOMELAND SECURITY COUNCIL
OFFICE OF NATIONAL DRUG CONTROL POLICY
OFFICE OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY POLICY
OFFICE OF THE UNITED STATES TRADE REPRESENTATIVE
OVERSEAS PRIVATE INVESTMENT CORPORATION
desc: The Overseas Private Investment Corporation works with the U.S. private sector to help solve critical world challenges.

name: AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION
desc: The African Development Foundation provides grants to community groups and small enterprises that benefit under-served and marginalized groups in Africa.

name: AMERICAN BATTLE MONUMENTS COMMISSION
desc: The American Battle Monuments Commission manages overseas military cemeteries, and memorials, monuments, and markers. Nearly all the cemeteries and memorials honor those who served in World War I or World War II.

name: ARMED FORCES RETIREMENT HOME
desc: The Gulfport and Washington campuses of the Armed Forces Retirement Home are retirement centers for veterans of the U.S. military.

name: FOREST AND WILDLIFE CONSERVATION, MILITARY RESERVATIONS
ARCHITECTURAL AND TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS COMPLIANCE BOARD
COMMITTEE FOR PURCHASE FROM PEOPLE WHO ARE BLIND OR SEVERELY DISABLED, ACTIVITIES
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA GENERAL AND SPECIAL PAYMENTS
FEDERAL FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS EXAMINATION COUNCIL APPRAISAL SUBCOMMITTEE
RECOVERY ACT ACCOUNTABILITY AND TRANSPARENCY BOARD
